ðŸ’¡Turning off notifications

From Letter 33

Sometimes a stress reliever can be so incredibly obvious but you just need another little push from a friend to actually follow through. Iâ€™m in a few discords with Jill, two that she runs, and in the welcome channel she reminds everyone to mute the channels theyâ€™re not interested inâ€”itâ€™s very silly to me how impactful that push is. Iâ€™m obsessed with knowing everything and so honestly, I know that if I do not take away the option of reading through or checking something, it will take away my attention. Iâ€™ve basically muted all of my notifications on my phone besides texts, no push notifications from Twitter, nothing from Discord, nothing at all. It is so, so good for my brain, it is such a stupid easy thing to do but I truly wouldnâ€™t without friends reminding me it is, in fact, something you should do.

â€“ Summer

From Letter 56

But since the whole point of these follow-up letters is to talk about our recommendations, I will say that part of why I loved reading this is because I am such a sucker for pieces that unpack other styles, forms, archetypes, etc. of writing.
